JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Teaching associate professor within the field of the history and culture of the English-speaking world
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Department of English, Germanic and Romance Studies, Faculty of Humanities, University of Copenhagen (UCPH), Denmark, invites applications for a teaching associate professor within the field of the history and culture of the English-speaking world to be filled by 1 August 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter.

The employment is full-time and expires without further notice 31 July 2025 (3 years).

The Department of English, Germanic and Romance Studies provides training in the main Western European languages – English, German, French, Italian and Spanish – and the communities and cultures in which these languages are spoken. English offers programs from BA to Ph.D. level. Research is carried out in four main areas:

  1. English language and language-usage in a contrasting perspective
  2. English-language literature
  3. History and society in the English-speaking world
  4. Foreign language acquisition and didactics
Job content
The teaching associate professor, in collaboration with the permanent lecturers, will organize and conduct teaching primarily within the history and cultures of the English-speaking world. The teaching associate professor must also be able to organize and carry out the examinations and other evaluations associated with the courses. The applicant is expected to have experience and desire to integrate and develop new formats for online education.

Qualification requirements
Appointment as a teaching associate professor requires a master's degree in English or the equivalent, master English in speech and writing at C2 level (according to the Common European Framework of Reference) and have relevant experience teaching in English.

Applicants must submit information about previous teaching experience, including documentation for completed assistant professorship training.

In addition to teaching duties and any academic development tasks, the position of teaching associate professor may include supervision and guidance of teaching assistant professors.

For further information about the position, please contact Christian Jensen, e-mail: chrjen@hum.ku.dk.

Further information on qualification requirements for teaching associate professors can be found in the Memorandum on Job Structure for Academic Staff at Danish Universities 2019 here: https://employment.ku.dk/faculty/criteria-for-recognising-merit/dokumenter/Ministerial_Order_no._1443_of_11_December_2019_on_Job_Structure_for_Academic_Staff_at_Universities.pdf

Application
Submit the application online in Adobe PDF or Word format.
Please click on the “Apply now” icon at the bottom of the page.

The application must be written in English and include the following enclosures:

  • Application letter/cover letter (max 1 page).
  • Curriculum vitae (with applicant’s e-mail & telephone number).
  • Documentation of qualifications (examination certificates/PhD diploma, etc.).
  • Documentation of teaching qualifications (organization of courses, teaching materials, conducting courses and other teaching).
Only material in Danish, Norwegian, Swedish and English can be expected to be assessed.

Appointment procedure
After the application deadline, the Head of Department selects applicants for assessment on the advice of the Appointment Committee. All applicants are notified whether their application has been accepted for assessment. The Dean subsequently appoints an expert assessment committee tasked with carrying out an assessment of the selected applicants for the specific post. Selected applicants are notified of the composition of the committee. Applicants are ultimately offered the opportunity of commenting on the part of the assessment relating to themselves before the appointment is finalized.

Further information about the application procedure is available from HR officer, e-mail: hrsc@hrsc.ku.dk. Please refer to ID number 211-0001/22-2SL #1.

Salary and conditions of employment
Terms of appointment and salary will be in accordance with an agreement between the Ministry of Finance and The Danish Confederation of Professional Associations (AC). The salary range starts at DKK 33.000 (EUR 4400) + a 17,1 % contribution to the pension scheme. It is possible to negotiate salary supplements on an annual basis.

For more information about the different pension schemes, please read more here: https://ism.ku.dk/salary-tax-pension/pension/

If you consider applying from abroad, you may find useful information on how it is to work in Denmark and at UCPH here: http://ism.ku.dk, http://www.nyidanmark.dk/en-us/frontpage.htm and https://www.workindenmark.dk/

UCPH wishes to encourage everyone interested in this post to apply, regardless of personal background.

The closing date for applications is 16 May 2022 23:59 CEST
Applications or supplementary material received thereafter will not be considered.
